articles.title: Repatriation of  unconverted long-term prisoners urged
articles.content:
Repatriation of unconvertedlong-term prisoners urged
   Pyongyang, March 9 (KCNA) -- The Left Democratic Front of 
Bangladesh, the Bangladesh Solidarity Committee for 
Supporting Korea's Reunification and the Bangladesh-Korea 
Friendship Association published a joint statement on March 
3 demanding the repatriation of unconverted long-term 
prisoners in South Korea.
   Old Kim In So and Ham Se Hwan should have been sent back 
home immediately after the war according to the Korean 
armistice agreement, the statement said, adding: But they 
had been imprionsed for decades, being tortured and 
maltreated and have not yet been sent back to their 
hometowns due to the illegal and inhumanitarian moves of the 
South Korean authorities.
   The statement demanded the South Korean authorities 
promptly allow those unconverted long-term prisoners to come 
back to reunite their families even in the evening of their 
life.

articles.title: "Mindan" urges repeal of evil laws in S. Korea
articles.content:
"Mindan" urges repealof evil laws in S. Korea
   Tokyo, March 7 (KNS-KCNA) -- Korean compatriots under 
"mindan" (the South Korean residents association in Japan) 
held a meeting here on Feb. 23 urging the repeal of 
retrogressively revised "labour laws" and "law on the agency 
for national security planning" and a probe into the truth 
behind the Hanbo loan scandal.
   They said in a resolution adopted at the meeting that the 
ruling and opposition parties of South Korea should nullify 
the railroaded evil laws and reamend them in a democratic 
way and that the special investigation committee should 
thoroughly probe the truth behind the Hanbo incident and 
clarify the substance of outside pressure.
   They also called for enactment of a bill on preventing 
irregularities and democratic amendment of the "political 
fund law".

articles.title: Korea-Japan joint consultative meeting on Japan's wartimes crimes
articles.content:
Korea-Japan joint consultative meeting on Japan's wartime crimes
   Tokyo, March 7 (KNS-KCNA) -- A Korea-Japan national 
consultative meeting of groups for investigation into 
the forcible draft of Koreans was held in osaka on February 
22.
   The meeting heard reports on the fact-finding groups' 
activities in different areas. 
   It was decided there to launch a one million-signature 
campaign for setting up a "council for probing the wartime 
crimes of Japan".
   The meeting adopted an emergency appeal.

articles.title: Literature appeared in Seoul
articles.content:
Literature appeared in Seoul
   Pyongyang, March 9 (KCNA) -- Many copies of literature 
calling for the overthrow of the Kim Young Sam "regime" were 
scattered in Jongro district, Seoul, on March 7, according 
to a radio report from Seoul.
   The literature says:
   The only wayout is to overthrow the present "government" 
and let us conclude the struggle for repeal of evil labor 
laws with the overthrow of the present "government".

articles.title: All-people rally held in S. Korea
articles.content:
All-people rally held in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, March 9 (KCNA) -- The Korean Confederation of 
Trade Unions and the National Measure Committee for 
Democracy held an all-people rally to condemn the revised 
labour laws and law on the agency for national security 
planning and get the decadent "government" resigned in Seoul 
and ten other places throughout South Korea on march 8 with 
the attendance of more than 50,000 workers and members, a 
Seoul-based radio said.
   At the rally the Korean Confederation of Trade Unions 
said that in case the fascist clique wind up the revised 
"labor laws" not in line with international standards, the 
organisation would define it as the second retrogressive 
revision of the "labour laws" made only for party interests. 
It declared it would conduct a campaign against the evil 
labour laws and a general strike.
   The organisation also vowed to concentrate on a struggle 
for right to existence and basic rights of labor.

articles.title: Utterances inviting indignation
articles.content:
Utterances inviting indignation 
  Pyongyang, March 9 (KCNA) -- Chief cabinet secretary of 
Japan Kajiyama talked about coping with an "event of 
contingency" on the Korean Peninsula, "countering capacity" 
and "establishing legal system" and said that this is a big 
task of Japan-U.S. consultation". 
   Minju Joson today, commenting on this, says that his 
utterances prove that the Japanese reactionaries try to 
step up the conversion of Japan into a military power and 
overseas aggression with  the backing of the U.S.
   The analyst says:
   the Japanese reactionaries have worked hard for turning 
Japan into a military power and  dispatching troops  
overseas under the cloak of the "U.S.-Japan security 
system".
   They are scheming to push ahead with the arms buildup 
and military reinvasion by clamouring about  the "emergency" 
on the Korean peninsula.
   They  have obstructed in every way the improvement of 
relations between the DPRK and the U.S. afraid of losing a 
pretext of emergency on the Korean peninsula and encouraged 
the south Korean puppets' moves for the north-south 
confrontation to keep the tension on the Korean Peninsula. 
   With no trick the Japanese reactionaries can conceal 
their intention.   However hard they may resort to a false 
propoganda about "threat" from the DPRK, it cannot be true.
   The "emergency" on the Korean Peninsula is a prelude to 
reinvasion upon Korea.
   If the Japanese reactionaries stage a comeback to the 
DPRK, it will move up their self-ruin.

articles.title: Don't bring calamity upon themselves
articles.content:
Don't bring calamity upon themselves 
    Pyongyang, March 9 (KCNA) -- The South Korean puppets 
are squandering a huge amount of money for purchasing war 
supplies from the beginning of the year and some countries 
are now vying with each other in making arms sales contract 
with the puppets and delivering war supplies to them.
   Rodong Sinmun today, commenting on this, says that South 
Korea has turned into an exhibition of lethal weapons and a 
global arms market.    The analyst goes on:
   The arms buildup of the South Korean puppets and some 
countries' arms export are rendering the tense situation of 
the Korean peninsula more strained and confrontation between 
the north and South of Korea acute.
   The tensions on the Korean Peninsula are exerting a grave 
influence on peace and security in Asia and the rest of the 
world.
   For the relaxation of tensions and preservation of peace 
on the Korean peninsula it is imperative to stop an act 
harmful to them.
   We will make every possible effort for peace on the 
Korean peninsula and never pardon those who ignor our 
efforts for peace and take the road of war.
   Those who encourage the South Korean puppets to a war 
against the northern half of Korea through arms sales will 
pay dearly for it.
   The anti-DPRK arms buildup of the South Korean puppets 
and some countries' delivery of arms to them will bring 
a calamity upon themselves.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on trick of Kim Young Sam group
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on trick of Kim Young Sam group 
    Pyongyang, March 9 (KCNA) -- The Kim Young Sam group 
declared an halt to the "negotiations for rewritting the 
labour laws" and has put in force the revised labour laws.
   Rodong Sinmun today in a commentary says that this 
is an unbearable mockery of and challenge to the South 
Korean workers and people of other strata calling for repeal 
of the labor laws and enactment of democratic labor laws.
   If the Kim Young Sam group have had an iota of reason and 
conscience, they should have lent an ear to the voices of 
the south Korean people and the progressives of the world 
and withdrawn the retrogressively revised labor laws, the 
analyst says, and goes on:
   However, they have employeed cunning techniques to 
enforce them, talking about the "legitimacy of the labor 
laws".
   The "negotiations between the ruling and opposition 
parties" for "rewritting the labor laws" were a farce of the 
puppets designed to avoid the public protests against the 
fascist laws.
   By enforcing the murderous labor laws, the Kim Young Sam 
group betrayed their true colors as the vicious enemy of the 
South Korean working people, including the workers.
   The South Korean workers should not be taken in by a 
trick of the puppets but continue their stubborn struggle 
against Kim Young Sam and fascist laws till their just 
demand will be met. They, therefore, should overthrow the 
kim Young Sam group in the grip of a serious crisis caused 
by the hanbo loan scandal.
